required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Renal Function, Efficacy, and Safety When Switching From Tenofovir/Emtricitabine Plus a Protease Inhibitor/Ritonavir, to a Combination of Raltegravir (MK-0518) Plus Nevirapine Plus Lamivudine in HIV-1 Participants With Suppressed Viremia and Impaired Renal Function (MK-0518-284)
clinical_study.official_title: Switching From Regimens Consisting of a RTV-Boosted Protease Inhibitor Plus TDF/FTC to a Combination of Raltegravir Plus Nevirapine and Lamivudine in HIV Patients With Suppressed Viremia and Impaired Renal Function (RANIA Study) (Pilot Study) Protocol MK-0518-284-03

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate changes in renal function, efficacy, and safety when switching from a combination of tenofovir/emtricitabine (TDF/FTC) plus a protease inhibitor/ritonavir (PI/r) to a combination of raltegravir (MK-0518) plus nevirapine plus lamivudine in human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-1 infected participants with suppressed viremia and impaired renal function.

clinical_study.why_stopped: This study was terminated early due to poor recruitment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
primary_outcome.description: Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) was estimated from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD)-6 equation. The MDRD-6 equation = 198 × [serum creatinine(mg/dL)]^−0.858 × [age]−0.167 × [0.822 if patient is female] × [1.178 if patient is black] × [serum urea nitrogen concentration (mg/dL)]^−0.293 × [urine urea nitrogen excretion (g/d)]^0.249.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Suppressed Viremia (<50 Copies/mL HIV-1 Ribonucleic Acid [RNA]) at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma was to be collected at Week 48 in order to quantify HIV-1 RNA. and identify the percentage of participants with <50 copies/mL HIV-1 RNA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Suppressed Viremia (<50 Copies/mL HIV-1 RNA) at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma was to be collected at Week 96 in order to quantify HIV-1 RNA. and identify the percentage of participants with <50 copies/mL HIV-1 RNA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Decline in Renal Function at Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Decline in renal function was to be assessed by evaluating MDRD-6, creatinine clearance and serum phosphate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Failure (HIV-1 RNA > 50 Copies/mL)
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma was to be collected up to Week 96 in order to quantify HIV-1 RNA, and identify the percentage of participants with >50 copies/mL HIV-1 RNA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of HIV-RNA Absolute Values
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma was to be collected at baseline and Week 96 in order to determine the change from baseline in HIV-1 RNA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mutations Associated With Resistance to NRTIs, NNRTIs, INI, at Virological Failure.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were to be identified with mutations associated with Nucleoside/ Nucleotide Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NRTIs), Non-nucleoside Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (NNRTIs), and Integrase Inhibitor (INI). Virological failure is defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA >200 copies/mL at least two weeks apart while on previous or current ARV therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Absolute CD4+ T-lymphocyte Count
secondary_outcome.description: Cluster of Differentiation 4 + (CD4+) T-lymphocyte cell counts were to be determined at baseline and Week 96, in order to determine the change from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Altered Liver Enzymes and Lipid Profile
secondary_outcome.description: Values of liver enzymes and lipids were to be determined from laboratory tests, in order to identify the percentage of participants classified with altered values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Altered Values of Tubular Kidney Injury Markers.
secondary_outcome.description: Values of tubular kidney injury markers. were to be determined, in order to identify the percentage of participants classified with altered values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Having Changes From Baseline in Metabolic Bone Markers
secondary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in metabolic bone markers, serum Bone Specific Alkaline Phosphatase (s-BSAP) and C-telopeptides of type 1 Collagen (s-CTx), were to be determined, in order to classify the percentage of participants with changes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration Time Curve From Time 0 the Last Measurement Time t (AUC0-t) for Raltegravir and Nevirapine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 12: Fasted state (0 h) and 1, 2, 3, 6 and 12 h post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were to be collected in Week 12 in order to use the trapezoidal method to determine the AUC0-t of Raltegravir and Nevirapine

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Concentration (Ctrough) for Raltegravir and Nevirapine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 12 and 48: at the end of dosing interval at 12 h
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were to be collected in Weeks 12 and 48 in order to use the trapezoidal method to determine the Ctrough, the lowest concentration reached by the drug before the next dose is administered, of Raltegravir and Nevirapine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Genotypic Resistance at Virologic Failure.
secondary_outcome.description: Genotypic resistance measures the presence of particular HIV-1 mutations that give rise to drug resistance. Virological failure is defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA >200 copies/mL at least two weeks apart while on previous or current ARV therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adherence to Study Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: An Adherence Questionnaire was to be given in order to determine the percentage of participants who adhered to study therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Bone Disease Risk Assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Bone disease risk assessment was to be based on a Fracture Risk Assessment Tool (FRAX®) score in participants > 40 years old, and the change from baseline determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the VACS Index
secondary_outcome.description: The Veterans Aging Cohort Risk Index (VACS Index) combines various clinical biomarkers into a cumulative index weighted according to the risk of all-cause mortality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing a Decline of Renal Function
secondary_outcome.description: Decline in renal function was to be assessed by evaluating MDRD-6, creatinine clearance and serum phosphate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in eGFR at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) was estimated from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD)-6 equation. The MDRD-6 equation = 198 × [serum creatinine(mg/dL)]^−0.858 × [age]−0.167 × [0.822 if patient is female] × [1.178 if patient is black] × [serum urea nitrogen concentration (mg/dL)]^−0.293 × [urine urea nitrogen excretion (g/d)]^0.249.

arm_group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg oral twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg oral once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg oral twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg oral twice daily for 96 weeks

Tenofovir/emtricitabine 300/200 mg oral once daily plus 1) lopinavir/ritonavir 400/100 mg oral twice daily or 800/200 mg oral once daily, or 2) atazanavir/ritonavir 300/100 mg oral once daily, or 3) darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg oral once daily or 600/100 mg oral twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male, or non-pregnant, non-breastfeeding female
- No previous history of virological failure
- No previous exposure to non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors or integrase inhibitors
- No previous history of intolerance to lamivudine
- At least 2 documented plasma HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL and no HIV-1 >50 copies/mL in the 12 months before screening
- Receiving the same protease inhibitor/ritonavir plus tenofovir/emtricitabine combination for at least the 6 months before screening
- Has no major International Antiviral Society (IAS)-USA mutations on genotype testing performed before starting antiretroviral treatment
- Sexually-active participants and their partners of child-bearing potential agree to use a medically acceptable method of contraception from 2 weeks before Day 1 and for at least 6 months after the last dose of study drug (postmenopausal women are not required to use contraception; sexually-active male participants with a female partner of child-bearing potential must provide written informed consent to information regarding any pregnancy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Positive for hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg+) or anticipated need for hepatitis C virus treatment
- Liver cirrhosis
- Has a history of diabetes mellitus, defined as initiation of antidiabetic treatment or verification of diabetes in a case report form
- Has any cancer, excluding stable Kaposi Sarcoma
- Allergy or sensitivity to the investigational product or excipients
- Female participant who is nursing
- Female participant who is pregnant or intends to become pregnant
- Has an active Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS)-defining event except stable Kaposi Sarcoma or HIV Wasting Syndrome
- Received any investigational drug within 30 days before screening
- Participated in any other clinical trial within 30 days before signing informed consent for the current trial

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infected adults with stable suppressed HIV-1 ribonucleic acid (RNA) from at least 12 months prior to the screening visit, and with a current stable anti-retroviral (ARV) regimen were enrolled in this trial.

group.title: Raltegravir Plus Nevirapine Plus Lamivudine
group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

group.title: Protease Inhibitor/Ritonavir Plus Tenofovir/Emtricitabine
group.description: Tenofovir/emtricitabine 300/200 mg orally once daily plus 1) lopinavir/ritonavir 400/100 mg orally twice daily or 800/200 mg orally once daily, or 2) atazanavir/ritonavir 300/100 mg orally once daily, or 3) darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg orally once daily or 600/100 mg orally twice daily

group.title: Raltegravir Plus Nevirapine Plus Lamivudine
group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

group.title: Protease Inhibitor/Ritonavir Plus Tenofovir/Emtricitabine
group.description: Tenofovir/emtricitabine 300/200 mg orally once daily plus 1) lopinavir/ritonavir 400/100 mg orally twice daily or 800/200 mg orally once daily, or 2) atazanavir/ritonavir 300/100 mg orally once daily, or 3) darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg orally once daily or 600/100 mg orally twice daily

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Sex: Female, Male

measure.title: Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
measure.description: Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) was estimated from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD)-6 equation. The MDRD-6 equation = 198 × [serum creatinine(mg/dL)]^−0.858 × [age]−0.167 × [0.822 if patient is female] × [1.178 if patient is black] × [serum urea nitrogen concentration (mg/dL)]^−0.293 × [urine urea nitrogen excretion (g/d)]^0.249.
measure.population: Data for eGFR at baseline were not determined for 1 participant in each treatment group.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
outcome.description: Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) was estimated from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD)-6 equation. The MDRD-6 equation = 198 × [serum creatinine(mg/dL)]^−0.858 × [age]−0.167 × [0.822 if patient is female] × [1.178 if patient is black] × [serum urea nitrogen concentration (mg/dL)]^−0.293 × [urine urea nitrogen excretion (g/d)]^0.249.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medications and who had both a baseline assessment, and at least one post-baseline assessment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Suppressed Viremia (<50 Copies/mL HIV-1 Ribonucleic Acid [RNA]) at Week 48
outcome.description: Plasma was to be collected at Week 48 in order to quantify HIV-1 RNA. and identify the percentage of participants with <50 copies/mL HIV-1 RNA.
outcome.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

group.title: Raltegravir
group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

group.title: Nevirapine
group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

measure.title: Trough Concentration (Ctrough) for Raltegravir and Nevirapine
measure.description: Blood samples were to be collected in Weeks 12 and 48 in order to use the trapezoidal method to determine the Ctrough, the lowest concentration reached by the drug before the next dose is administered, of Raltegravir and Nevirapine.
measure.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Genotypic Resistance at Virologic Failure.
outcome.description: Genotypic resistance measures the presence of particular HIV-1 mutations that give rise to drug resistance. Virological failure is defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA >200 copies/mL at least two weeks apart while on previous or current ARV therapy.
outcome.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

group.title: Raltegravir Plus Nevirapine Plus Lamivudine
group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

group.title: Protease Inhibitor/Ritonavir Plus Tenofovir/Emtricitabine
group.description: Tenofovir/emtricitabine 300/200 mg orally once daily plus 1) lopinavir/ritonavir 400/100 mg orally twice daily or 800/200 mg orally once daily, or 2) atazanavir/ritonavir 300/100 mg orally once daily, or 3) darunavir/ritonavir 800/100 mg orally once daily or 600/100 mg orally twice daily

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Genotypic Resistance at Virologic Failure.
measure.description: Genotypic resistance measures the presence of particular HIV-1 mutations that give rise to drug resistance. Virological failure is defined as 2 consecutive plasma HIV-1 RNA >200 copies/mL at least two weeks apart while on previous or current ARV therapy.
measure.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Adherence to Study Therapy
outcome.description: An Adherence Questionnaire was to be given in order to determine the percentage of participants who adhered to study therapy.
outcome.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Bone Disease Risk Assessment
outcome.description: Bone disease risk assessment was to be based on a Fracture Risk Assessment Tool (FRAX®) score in participants > 40 years old, and the change from baseline determined.
outcome.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

measure.description: Bone disease risk assessment was to be based on a Fracture Risk Assessment Tool (FRAX®) score in participants > 40 years old, and the change from baseline determined.
measure.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the VACS Index
outcome.description: The Veterans Aging Cohort Risk Index (VACS Index) combines various clinical biomarkers into a cumulative index weighted according to the risk of all-cause mortality.
outcome.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing a Decline of Renal Function
outcome.description: Decline in renal function was to be assessed by evaluating MDRD-6, creatinine clearance and serum phosphate.
outcome.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing a Decline of Renal Function
measure.description: Decline in renal function was to be assessed by evaluating MDRD-6, creatinine clearance and serum phosphate.
measure.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in eGFR at Week 96
outcome.description: Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) was estimated from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD)-6 equation. The MDRD-6 equation = 198 × [serum creatinine(mg/dL)]^−0.858 × [age]−0.167 × [0.822 if patient is female] × [1.178 if patient is black] × [serum urea nitrogen concentration (mg/dL)]^−0.293 × [urine urea nitrogen excretion (g/d)]^0.249.
outcome.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

group.description: Raltegravir 400 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks; plus nevirapine 200 mg orally once daily for 14 days followed by nevirapine 200 mg orally twice daily, plus lamivudine 150 mg orally twice daily for 96 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline in eGFR at Week 96
measure.description: Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) was estimated from the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD)-6 equation. The MDRD-6 equation = 198 × [serum creatinine(mg/dL)]^−0.858 × [age]−0.167 × [0.822 if patient is female] × [1.178 if patient is black] × [serum urea nitrogen concentration (mg/dL)]^−0.293 × [urine urea nitrogen excretion (g/d)]^0.249.
measure.population: Due to poor enrollment the study was terminated early; therefore data for secondary outcome measures were not collected, and were not analyzed.

reported_events.desc: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study treatment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The investigator agrees to provide to the sponsor 45 days prior to submission for publication or presentation, review copies of abstracts or manuscripts for publication that report any results of the trial. The sponsor shall have the right to review and comment with respect to publications, abstracts, slides, and manuscripts and the right to review and comment on the data analysis and presentation.
